title: I Have 190mbps XfinityBlast----*I Lag 400ms every 1min in game PvP/Bot Matches*

replies.body:
When you're seeing higher latency when on both a wired and wireless connection, it's usually due to routing issues with your ISP. I strongly recommend running a set of traceroutes [using our guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2) or running a set with [this nifty program called WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/) for 5min using this test IP address: 192.64.170.1

Submit the log as an attachment to our support agents [with your ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and we'll have one of our tech specialists help you resolve this for good. Let me know if you have any other questions!

Followed guide, did DMZ port forwarding to open all, still lagging 400-ms 500 ms, and I contacted ISP my Download speed is still Excellent over 150mpbs and 11 upload mpbs, i also disable peer 2 peer in settings, please help

Even though your connection may be excellent, we don't know for sure if your network is taking the long way to the game server.  Our [Tech Team](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) will be able to look into this, and getting some logs prepared can get you help faster.  We have a [handy tool here ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs)that can automatically get most of the logs we need, and also a [Network Analysis ](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs)to check the properties behind your connection.  Thanks for your patience with this, and rest easy knowing tech specialists can help out!

Thank you!, ok I received this response from an awesome tech


> ***Ichiban Ramen here with Riot Tech support and today I'll be assisting you. I'm sorry to hear that you've been experiencing connection issues with the League of Legends client. Based on those logs, it looks like you're having routing issues. If you take a look you'll notice that you're intermittently spiking over 200ms at your router level. This isn't something we can assist with, you'll need to contact your ISP again and have their higher tiered technicians troubleshoot this with you. In the meantime, there are a number of networking issues that can be resolved by performing a quick reset or power cycle of your home network. I have provided some step-by-step instructions to help you perform a power cycle for your home network:
> 
> Shut down all computers connected to your home network (modem/router/gateway).
> Power down/unplug your router, if you use one.
> Power down/unplug your modem. Have both devices off for at least 60 seconds. Note: If your modem has a battery backup you will need to take the battery out for 60 seconds or use the reset button on the modem.
> Turn on your modem and allow it to completely boot up. Wait until the indicator lights on the device stop blinking and display a steady green connection.
> Turn on the router (if you have one) and allow to completely boot up as well.
> Start the computers and allow it to completely boot up and re-establish an internet connection.
> Let me know if you have any other questions or need more clarification.
> 
> BowlO'Ramen 
> Tech Support - Fizz OP
> "Lunch time!"***



So basically it looks like my ISP is lying to me, can you reconmend any other ISP besides comcast? I just need a better service provider for gaming

and general
400 ms. thats exactly what i get when my lag spikes. its a pattern.
